meanings.definition: The act of twisting or turning in a circular or spiral course.
meanings.sent1: The rope's windings around the pole were tight.
meanings.sent2: The watch had intricate windings inside.
meanings.sent3: The windings of the river made it look like a coiled snake.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful windings captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The windings of the maze confused the participants.

meanings.definition: A series of turns or twists.
meanings.sent1: The path through the forest had many windings.
meanings.sent2: The old staircase had ornate iron windings.
meanings.sent3: The windings of the story kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent4: The windings of fate brought them together unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The windings of the road led to hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: The manner in which something is wound or twisted.
meanings.sent1: The delicate windings of the yarn created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully studied the windings of the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The windings of the conversation took an unexpected turn.
meanings.sent4: The windings of tradition were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The intricate windings of the vine climbed up the wall.
